intro: Okay, okay... you won't find the word "yacht" in any translation of the Bible. But we're using it as a synonym for boat and asking you to tell us about the sailors of Scripture

questions.ask: What wayward prophet was thrown overboard by pagan sailors frightened by a violent storm at sea?
What alliterative brothers were in a boat when Jesus called them to be His disciples?
What was Jesus doing in a boat immediately before calming a storm that terrified His disciples?
What wise and wealthy king, who built God's first temple, also built ships on the Red Sea?
What island's people welcomed the apostle Paul and 275 other people after their ship broke apart in the Adriatic Sea?

intro: That's an Old West term for "cowards" - and there were a few of them in the Bible. Tell us what you remember about these.

questions.ask: How many times during Jesus' arrest and trial did Simon Peter deny he knew the Lord?
What did the terrified disciples think they were seeing when Jesus walked across the water to their boat?
What wicked queen threatened the life of the prophet Elijah, causing him to pray to God that he would die?
What conspiring son of King David caused his father to flee for his life from Jerusalem?
What Israelite leader, preparing for battle against the Midianites, saw twenty-two thousand warriors - more than two-thirds of his army - desert when given the chance?

intro: The yoke's on you! Yeah, we know that's a bad pun, but there are yokes in the Bible that belong on people, as well as animals. What can you recall about them?

questions.ask: How did Jesus describe the yoke He places on His followers?
What color if heifer - which had never worn a yoke - were Moses and Aaron instructed to sacrifice?
What kind of yoking did the apostle Paul warn the church at Corinth about?
What Old Testament prophet, who called himself "a child", wore a wooden yoke as an object lesson?
What king, the son of Solomonm threatened to place his subjects under a heavy yoke - and caused many of the tribes of Israel to rebel?

intro: You have to be thirty-five to become president of the United States. But you can serve the Lord at any age. What do you know about these five young people of the Bible?

questions.ask: What instrument did the young David play to soothe the troubled spirit of King Saul?
What boy,destined to become a great prophet of Israel, ministered in the temple under the priest Eli?
How old was the boy Jesus when He amazed people in the temple with His spiritual insights?
What young king removed all the mediums and spirits from Judah, as required in the book of the law found by his priest, Hilkiah?
What young relative of Paul discovered and reported a plot to kill the apostle in Jerusalem?
